headline: Four years of war in Ukraine: Odesa's complex 'derussification'
description: The large southern city had long been under Russian and then Soviet influence due to its port and strategic access to the Black Sea.

headline: Mexico deploys 10,000 troops to restore order after violence linked to the death of drug lord 'El Mencho'
EU plunged into uncertainty over US trade deal
Trump's threat of sending American hospital ship to Greenland revives tension
description: Donald Trump's initiative, which came after a crew member from a US submarine was evacuated to Nuuk, has exasperated the Greenlandic and Danish governments.

headline: More than 200 inmates launch hunger strike to seek benefits under Venezuela's new amnesty law
description: According to human rights organizations, the law passed by Parliament excludes hundreds of cases of people unjustly convicted for defending their social rights or for criticizing those in power. Prisoners are also protesting against their detention conditions.

headline: The secrets of neighing are finally revealed
description: To produce this unique sound, the horse performs a 'biphonation': It cries out and whistles at the same time.

headline: Will French investigators soon use American DNA databases to solve cold cases?
description: In the SURE bill submitted on February 19, the justice minister plans to introduce an article that would, in particular, allow 'the use of genetic genealogy' in certain cases. These DNA samples come from 'recreational' tests offered by companies over the internet.

headline: Panama takes control of canal ports from Hong Kong group
China's retired rural workers are finding rest impossible
UK police release ex-envoy Peter Mandelson on bail in Epstein case
After Heineken announces job cuts, the beer market faces major upheaval
US accuses China of increasing its nuclear arsenal
Kim Jong-un's sister elevated to the highest levels of power in North Korea
'Here Gaza,' and the rebirth of radio within the devastated territory
Snowstorm in northeastern US leaves 40 million people under weather warnings
War in Ukraine: 'The key issue is to deter Russia from attacking again'
Nearly 20 countries condemn Israel's annexation of the West Bank
France to revoke US envoy Kushner's government access after no-show
Giorgia Meloni's strong poll numbers, a deceptive success
The Ukrainian family torn by war and exile behind a famous photo published by Le Monde
description: A few days after the Russian invasion, photojournalist Laurence Geai captured the farewell of a Ukrainian family at Odesa train station. Four years later, the mother welcomed Le Monde to Cologne, Germany, where she lives as a refugee with her son and her mother, far from her husband, since enlisted in the army.

headline: We fact-checked 'Marty Supreme,' the biopic of a not-so-visionary table tennis player
description: The biopic produced by Timothée Chalamet draws inspiration from the American champion Marty Reisman. But it was his Japanese rival, Hiroji Satoh, who brought the sport into the modern era.

headline: Lyon drug traffickers hire Colombian hitmen to kill their rivals
description: Criminal cases involving Colombian nationals have become increasingly common in the Lyon area. According to the police, these individuals are believed to be mercenaries hired by French drug trafficking kingpins to terrorize or eliminate their rivals.

headline: Vladimir Putin, trapped by his own logic of war
Jean Pisani-Ferry: 'German commitment to rearmament is good news and a challenge for Europe'
'Lawless zones around Israel are the result of the Pax Judaica made possible by uncontested military hegemony'
